com.camerontec.util.datatypes

Interface DecimalView

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<DecimalView>, Printable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MutableCompactDecimal

    public interface DecimalView
extends Comparable<DecimalView>, Printable
    Read-only view over a decimal.

    • Method Summary

      • isWholeNumber

        boolean isWholeNumber()
        Return whether this is a whole number (i.e. has no fractional component).
        Returns:
        True if this is a whole number, false otherwise.

      • intValue

        int intValue()
        Return the (possibly) truncated integer value.
        Returns:
        The (possibly) truncated integer value.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - If the truncated value lies outside the valid integer range.
        See Also:
        intValueExact()

      • intValueExact

        int intValueExact()
        Return the integer value iff this is a whole number in the integer range.
        Returns:
        The integer value.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - If the value is not a whole number or the value lies outside the valid integer range.

      • longValue

        long longValue()
        Return the (possibly) truncated long value.
        Returns:
        The (possibly) truncated long value.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - If the truncated value lies outside the valid long range.
        See Also:
        longValueExact()

      • longValueExact

        long longValueExact()
        Return the long value iff this is a whole number in the long range.
        Returns:
        The long value if this is a whole number.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - If this is not a whole number or the value lies outside the valid long range.

      • doubleValue

        double doubleValue()
        Return the double value.

        The returned value is calculated as follows: 

           double value = mantissa * Math.pow(10.0, exponent);

        Note that this may result in a loss of precision as Java doubles cannot represent all floating point quantities.

        Returns:
        The double value.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - If this number lies outside the valid double range.

      • bigDecimalValue

        BigDecimal bigDecimalValue()
        Return the BigDecimal value.

        The returned value is calculated as follows: 

           BigDecimal value = new BigDecimal(BigInteger.valueOf(mantissa), -exponent);
        Returns:
        The BigDecimal value.
